These easy no yeast vegan cinnamon rolls feature sweet potato puree which makes them the most flavorful and soft homemade vegan cinnamon buns youâ€™ll ever make.  No dough-punching & no long wait for the dough to rise to make these cinnamon buns. 

Cinnamon buns make all mornings better.  We all know that! But if I told you you can take the old cinnamon roll to the next level, by adding some sweet potato? Would you trust me and try it? I hope you do, because boy these Sweet Potato Cinnamon Rolls! SO GOOD! Plus these are no-yeast cinnamon rolls â€“ vegan and no hour-long waiting around for the dough to rise.

recipeIngredient: 3/4 cup heated non dairy milk (such as almond, soy, light coconut or oat)
3 tbsp maple syrup or sugar of choice

recipeInstructions.text: In a bowl, mix in all of the wet ingredients until well combined.
recipeInstructions.name: In a bowl, mix in all of the wet ingredients until well combined.

recipeInstructions.text: In another bowl mix all the dry ingredients really well.
recipeInstructions.name: In another bowl mix all the dry ingredients really well.

recipeInstructions.text: Add 2.5 cups of flour mixture into the wet and mix well. Depending on the consistency of your sweet potato puree/ mash and the sweetener used, you will need few tbsp or up to a cup of flour to make the mixture into just slightly sticky dough. You donâ€™t want to overwork the door as the more you mix and knead , sweet potato purÃ©e will leak more moisture)
recipeInstructions.name: Add 2.5 cups of flour mixture into the wet and mix well. Depending on the consistency of your sweet potato puree/ mash and the sweetener used, you will need few tbsp or up to a cup of flour to make the mixture into just slightly sticky dough. You donâ€™t want to overwork the door as the more you mix and knead , sweet potato purÃ©e will leak more moisture)

recipeInstructions.text: As soon as the mixture is dough like, bring it together. Cover the bowl with a towel and let it sit for least half an hour. Â The dough will rise a bit.
recipeInstructions.name: As soon as the mixture is dough like, bring it together. Cover the bowl with a towel and let it sit for least half an hour. Â The dough will rise a bit.

recipeInstructions.text: Transfer the dough on a working surface and using some flour, Lightly roll it out into 11x15 inch rectangle.
recipeInstructions.name: Transfer the dough on a working surface and using some flour, Lightly roll it out into 11x15 inch rectangle.

itemListElement.text: You can go two ways with the filling. Mix the sugar, cinnamon and oil to form a paste and then spread that onto the dough. Usually this requires lot more oil.
itemListElement.name: You can go two ways with the filling. Mix the sugar, cinnamon and oil to form a paste and then spread that onto the dough. Usually this requires lot more oil.

itemListElement.text: The other option is to brush the oil on the rolled out dough, mix sugar and cinnamon in a  bowl and sprinkle the sugar-cinnamon mixture on top.
itemListElement.name: The other option is to brush the oil on the rolled out dough, mix sugar and cinnamon in a  bowl and sprinkle the sugar-cinnamon mixture on top.

itemListElement.text: Once the filling has been spread, use a pizza cutter to cut the dough into 1 to 1.5 Â inch wide strips.
itemListElement.name: Once the filling has been spread, use a pizza cutter to cut the dough into 1 to 1.5 Â inch wide strips.

itemListElement.text: Roll each of the strips tightly to form your cinnamon rolls.
itemListElement.name: Roll each of the strips tightly to form your cinnamon rolls.

itemListElement.text: Place the rolls in a well-greased baking dish. For the amount of dough, you will need at least a 9 by 13 baking dish. Bake the buns at 375F(190C)Â  for 25-30 minutes. Once done, remove them from the oven, and serve warm.
